quote: Creating a wonderful drama is an art form, while comedy is just entertainment.
author: Jason Reitman

quote: Comedy vs. Satire [10w] Comedy pokes fun at society's self-inflation;satire deflates the balloon.
author: Beryl Dov

quote: Comedy is simply a funny way of being serious.
author: Peter Ustinov

quote: Comedy is a necessity to get through life with the fewest scars. Humor is the best antidote to help relieve all struggles.
author: Suzy Kassem,  Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem

quote: I have such a respect for comedy. It's a lot harder than doing drama, in my opinion; you have to have sort of an innate sense of humor. There are rules to comedy you can learn. But ultimately, it really does require a certain point of view on the world, and that really does appeal to me.
author: Elizabeth Banks

quote: Comedy has to be based on truth. You take the truth and you put a little curlicue at the end.
author: Sid Caesar

quote: Humor is very interesting to me. My films are not comedies, but there's comedy in them from time to time, absurdities, just like in real life.
author: David Lynch

quote: Comedy aims at representing men as worse, Tragedy as better than in actual life.
author: Aristotle,  Poetics

quote: The duty of comedy is to correct men by amusing them.
author: Moliere

quote: Comedy, we may say, is society protecting itself - with a smile.
author: J. B. Priestley

quote: My own inclination is to skew towards humor. They say that some people view life as a comedy, others as a tragedy. Me? Comedy all the way.
author: Lauren Willig

quote: Life is a comedy to those who think, a tragedy to those who feel.
author: Jean Racine

quote: I think the main thing about comedy and humor is that it's impossible and always was impossible to define.
author: Mike Nichols

quote: Life doesn't make any sense, and we all pretend it does. Comedy's job is to point out that it doesn't make sense, and that it doesn't make much difference anyway.
author: Eric Idle

quote: Most comedy is based on getting a laugh at somebody else's expense. And I find that that's just a form of bullying in a major way. So I want to be an example that you can be funny and be kind, and make people laugh without hurting somebody else's feelings.
author: Ellen DeGeneres

quote: The life of every individual, viewed as a whole and in general, and when only its most significant features are emphasized, is really a tragedy; but gone through in detail it has the character of a comedy.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer,  The World as Will and Representation, Vol 1

quote: Let's not call physical comedy falling down and pratfalls. All humor is physical, no matter how you dish it out. It's timing, like a dancer or an athlete would have.
author: Chevy Chase

quote: You can't study comedy; it's within you. It's a personality. My humor is an attitude.
author: Don Rickles

quote: Quite often, intent on conveying how things can go wrong for a culture (science fiction) or an individual (horror) or all of magical creation (fantasy), works of fantastika often preclude comedy, because humor gets in the way of messages of doom or struggle.
author: Paul Di Filippo

quote: I want to have fun. Life ain't no dress rehearsal. I want to have fun. I'm a comedian; I ain't no politician. So everything I do is with humor, with love.
author: Bernie Mac

quote: I love doing comedy. You don't get many good comedy scripts. They're rare. But, I do love playing comedy. Even in drama, I like to try to find the humor because I think it's very human.
author: Colm Meaney

quote: I love to bring humour into my work. Because comedy is not a huge part of the art world. And big-business film takes itself very seriously.
author: James Franco

quote: I don't really dissect comedy. Nothing kills off humor more than overanalyzing it.
author: David Steinberg

quote: I think in life, the sense of humor and comedy always exists.
author: Mike Epps

quote: I try to give all my characters a sense of humor, so I guess I feel like I have done comedy, but maybe I'm better known for drama.
author: Kathy Baker

quote: Comedy was my sport. It taught me how to roll with the punches. Failure is the exact same as success when it comes to comedy because it just keeps coming. It never stops.
author: Emma Stone

quote: Tragedy is when I cut my finger. Comedy is when you fall into an open sewer and die.
author: Mel Brooks

quote: Comedy is so hard to do, so it was very cool to do dead pan humor.
author: Brittany Daniel

quote: I like doing comedy, I like doing drama. Naturally I like to do, I like doing dramas, I like conflict, and when I do a comedy, you know, I've found that, like, romantic comedy is the trickiest one, because often it's neither: it's not romantic and it's not funny. So, like, I like a comedy that's biting. It's biting humor or really quirky humor.
author: Matt Dillon

quote: Comedy is difficult for an actor. But I think I have a good sense of humor and manage to make people laugh and make them happy.
author: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan

quote: Finding a way to find humor in things that are hardcore is definitely something that, I think, the sitcom does best.
author: Megyn Price

quote: There is a thin line that separates laughter and pain, comedy and tragedy, humor and hurt.
author: Erma Bombeck

quote: Stand-up comedy is an art form and it dies unless you expand it.
author: Sam Kinison

quote: The world is a tragedy to those who feel, but a comedy to those who think.
author: Horace Walpole

quote: Feature-length film comedy is harder to pull off than the episodic sitcom - it doesn't have the same factory machinery up and running, teams of writers putting familiar characters through permutations - but that doesn't explain the widening quality gap that makes movie humor look like a genetic defective.
author: James Wolcott

quote: Life is a tragedy when seen in close-up, but a comedy in long-shot.
author: Charlie Chaplin

quote: All you have in comedy, in general, is just going with your instincts. You can only hope that other people think that what you think is funny is funny. I don't have an answer but I just try to plough straight ahead.
author: Will Ferrell

quote: If it gets laughs, it's funny.
author: Rachel Dratch

quote: I think great humor lies in playing the truth of a situation. I see myself as a performer and that applies to a Greek drama or a modern comedy.
author: Brendan Coyle

quote: Anyone who thinks they can write the perfect comedy that everyone will love is a fool. I can only write what I think is funny and hope that there is a likeminded audience out there.
author: Brendan O'Carroll

quote: Everything is funny as long as it is happening to somebody else.
author: Will Rogers

quote: Everything is funny, as long as it's happening to somebody else.
author: Will Rogers

quote: I'm sure I've all but lost friends by maintaining that, despite their love for it, I always saw Stanley Kramer's 'It's a Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad World' as more of an exercise in anti-comedy than humor.
author: Dick Cavett

quote: The way humor's usually used in horror, it's as a pressure-release valve; without it, the drama would escalate out of all control almost immediately.
author: Stephen Graham Jones

quote: I can't live without a sense of humor. I need to be laughing and entertained at all times.
author: Carlos Ponce

quote: Love: the sickest of Ironyâ€™s sick jokes. The place where logic and order go to die.
author: Christopher Moore,  Coyote Blue

quote: So my humor, I'd say, comes from a mixture of lowbrow comedy shows and highbrow theater. It's an interesting mix.
author: Jasper Fforde

quote: Every time I've done comedy in, like, traditional comedy clubs, there's always these comedians that do really well with audiences but that the other comedians hate because they're just, you know, doing kind of cheap stuff like dancing around or doing, like, very kind of base sex humor a lot, and stuff like that.
author: Aziz Ansari

quote: For the most part, comedians are pretty friendly with each other. They always say they badmouth each other, but most of the time, they're friends. We're the only ones that can really stand our type of humor.
author: Colin Quinn

quote: I really hate sitcoms on television with canned laughter and stuff. What really makes me laugh is the real-life stuff. I've got a dry sense of humor.
author: Katie Price
